title: How to Verify a GPG Signature

steps.title: Acquire the Public Key.
steps.content: Acquire the Public Key. Import the Public Key into GPG.

steps.title: Acquire a copy of the file in question.
steps.content: Acquire a copy of the file in question. Save it in a Folder.

steps.title: Acquire a copy of the signature-file in question.
steps.content: Acquire a copy of the signature-file in question. Save it in the same Folder.

steps.title: Open a command-line interface.
steps.content: Open a command-line interface. Change the working directory to the Folder where your file and signature-file are saved.

steps.title: Verify the signature.
steps.content: Verify the signature. Type the following command into a command-line interface: gpg --verify [signature-file] [file] E.g., if you have acquired (1) the Public Key 0x416F061063FEE659, (2) the Tor Browser Bundle file (tor-browser.tar.gz), and (3) the signature-file posted alongside the Tor Browser Bundle file (tor-browser.tar.gz.asc), You would type the following: gpg --verify tor-browser.tar.gz.asc tor-browser.tar.gz
